### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:When you play around with your dog they will have? Choices:  A: alive B: health C: fun D: playing dead E: black<n>Output:		A: alive<n><n>Input: Which of these is a person? Choices: A: house B: table C: cat D: car E: lamp<n>Output: A: house<n><n>Input: Do you have a dog? Choices: A. Yes B. No C. Cat D. Bed E. House<n>Output: A. Yes<n><n>Input: Do I have a dog? Choice: A. yes B. no C. cat D. bed E. house<n>Output: B. no<n><n>Input: Who is it in the mirror? Choices:  Choices: A: You B: Not you C: Me D: That lady E: That man<n>Output: D: That lady<n><n>Input: Where is my mango? Choices: A) At home B) Where its supposed to be C) At the shops<n>Output: A) At home<n><n>Input: Do we all know who my mango is? Choices: 1) All 2) Some 3)No.<n>Output: 3)No<n><n>Input: Can I have a glass of water? Choices: A B C D E<n>Output: C<n><n># Time: O( )<n># Space: O( ) <n># Method: Brute Force <n>class Solution:<n>    def FindErrorIndex(self, sentence, startIndex, stopIndex, incorrectWords):<n>        listIndex = []<n>        for i in range(startIndex, stopIndex + 1):<n>            chA = sentence[i][0]<n>            chB = sentence[i][1]<n>            # wrong words<n>            if(incorrectWords.index(chA) >= incorrectWords.index(f"{chB}") >= 0):<n>                listIndex.append(i)<n>        return list(set(range(0, len(listIndex)) + range(1, len(listIndex) - 1)) - range(1, len((listIndex)) - 1))[0]<n>

Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices: 0: yes, 1: no A: yes B: no C: what box D: who cares E: all of the above  <n>Output: D: what box<n><n>Input: What instrument may be used to measure the temperature? Choices: 14: thermometer A: thermometer B: clock C: scissors D: thermometer<n>Output: B: clock<n><n>Input: What machine do we use to prepare food? Choices: A: sewing machine B: toaster C: oven D: sewing machine E: microwave<n>Output: E: microwave <n>"""<n><n>def multiple_choice():<n><n>    file = "input.txt"<n>    text = file.readlines()<n>    print(text[1])<n>    <n>    choice = random.choice(text)<n>  <n>    #instruction if user selected 1 or 2<n>    if choice == '1' or choice == '2':<n>        print('')<n>        print('Choose one of the following:')<n>        print('------------------------------------------')<n>        response = input('What do you think? ').lower()<n>    #instruction else i.e. if user selects 3 or 4<n>    else:<n>        print('') <n>        print('Choices')<n>        print('-----------')<n>        for i in range(1,5):<n>            choice(i)<n>    if response == 'a':<n>        return 'What??'<n>    elif response == 'b':<n>        return 'That is correct.\n'<n>    elif response in ['c', 'd']:<n>        return 'wrong'<n>    elif response  == 'e':<n>        return 'You seem like a really smart dude or dudette.\n'<n>    else:<n>       return 'I cannot understand you! Did you meant to type a?'<n><n>a = multiple_choice()<n>b = multiple_choice()

Choices:  A: bike B: downtown C: building D: tool storage E: car<n>Output:		A: bike<n><n>Input:What might need a mop? Choices: 1. A: a swimming pool B: a fishbowl C: the ocean 2. a: beach D: floors<n>Output: B: a fishbow<n><n>Input: The house was very small. It only contained what room? Choices:  a: bedroom B: a den C: a living room D: bathroom E: hall way<n>Output: A: bedroom<n><n>```<n>import java.util.NoSuchElementException;<n>import java.util.*;<n><n>public class MultiChoiseQuestion<n>{<n>    public static void main(String[] args) throws NoSuchElementException<n>    {<n>        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);<n><n>        char choice = sc.next().charAt(0);<n>        switch (choice)<n>        {<n>            case 'a':System.out.println("a");<n>                break;<n>            case 'b':System.out.print("b);<n>                break;<n>        }<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n>

")<n>    a=Q3input()<n>    if a=='dictionary' and a.casefold()=='dictionary':<n>        return 1<n>    elif a=='dictionary' or a.casefold()=="dictionary":<n>        return 10<n>    elif a==None or a==' ':<n>        return 2<n>    else:<n>        return 0<n>if __name__=="__main__":<n>    for i in range(5):<n>        qn()<n>program()<n>```<n>* Case insensitive comparison was used for input()

(bedroom)<n>4. C * The sentence has been edited to read 'You might stay in shape if there is plenty of land nearby'. (exercise), 'How can you get in good _ _ _ _ _ '<n>5. A * The sentence which has now been written to read 'What should you drink at tea?'.<n><n>---<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? D:. 2.05pm<n><n># Instructions<n># Create a file called quiz.py where you write your code.<n># The function write_word should write a sentence to standard output using the words which appear as answers to the questions.<n># The function find_question should read the input_file,<n># then find the index of the question corresponding to the answer printed to standard out,<n># then return the question_number to the caller.<n><n>def write_word(word):<n>  #code here<n>  print(word)<n><n>def find_question(answer):<n>  #code to locate the input_file question that matches the answer passed in<n>  #return the index<n>  answer_index = 0<n>  for question in questions:<n>    if answer == question:<n>      answer_index = question_number<n>      break<n>  return answer_index<n><n>questions = read_input_file()<n>write_word(questions[0])<n>q_index = find_question("A")<n>write_word(word = questions[q_index])<n>q_index += 1<n>write_word(question = questions[q_i])<n><n>questions = read().

Suppose you have a 12-sided die where each of the six sides has a different color, and the other six sides are not colored. In how many different ways can you color six of the twelve sides?<n><n>Note: For this question, if a given side has the same color as one neighboring side (i.e., two adjacent sides have a shared color), do not count this as a different way to color the six sides, treat this as a duplicate color. For example, the following would be considered one way: $blue, blue, red.$ The following pairs would be considered duplicate colors: $red, red,$ $red, green. $<n><n>### Question :- You are playing tennis competitively and one of your opponents has just scored a point. You now have 97 points; what is the probability that you will win the first set?<n><n>### Note:The probability of taking in the set is 4/5. The question asks the probability of you winning the set which should be 5/6.<n><n>

Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? E: Dishes must be washed then rinsed and dish dried.<n>Output: C: the dishes first should be soaked, washing, and then rinsed.<n><n>Input: How did the boys get to where they were going? A: across the bridge B: on a bicycle C: in a car D: on foot<n>Output: D: on foot<n><n>### Instruction:<n><n>Input:The machine was very intricate<n><n>Expected Output: A: box B: Apparatus<n><n>Input:A: The dishes must first soak<n><n>Expected Output; E: The dishes must soak/sit first<n><n>### This code might work but it doesn't<n><n>#### code<n><n>```python<n>def string1(st):<n>    if st == 'A':<n>        return 'a box'<n>    if st =='b':<n>        return 'b'<n>    if st=='c':<n>        return 'c'<n>    if st=="d":<n>        return 'd'<n>    return 'E'<n><n>```<n><n>#### output<n><n>```python<n>print(string1('The machine was very intricare'))<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Instructions: Provide a function called str1 that takes a string as a parameter<n><n>The function returns a string based on the parameter of the function as per the requirements, which is shown below:<n><n>Expected Outputs:<n><n><n>```python<n>string1('The machine is very intricate')<n>```<n><n><n>```python "A: box"<n>```<n><n>```<n>python "b: b"<n>```<n><n><n>### Expected output:<n><n>```python<n>The machine was very intrica<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:John spent too much money buying products for his swollen testicles.  He did so because he was feeling what? Choices:  A: pleasure B: delight C: bankruptcy D: agony E: owning<n>Output:		D: agony<n><n>Input: What is the best thing about the car? Choices: 1. Its large. 2. Its big. 3. Its big. 4. Its large 5. Its large<n>Output: 5. Its large.<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>```python<n>import sys<n>sys.setrecursionlimit(10**8)<n><n><n>def solve(text):<n>    if len(text) == 0:<n>        return None<n><n>    tokens = text.split()<n>    tokens = [token.replace('\s', '') for token in tokens]<n>    return [tok for tok in tokens if not tok.isdigit()]<n><n><n>ans = []<n>for _ in range(10**8):<n>    input = sys.stdin.read()<n>    ans.append(solve(input))<n><n>for res, ans in zip(range(len(ans)), ans):<n>    print(ans[res] + " is a valid sentence, but" if ans[res] else '- ')<n>    print(ans + 'is not a valid sentence.')<n>    print('\n')<n>```

Choices:  A. the oil C. petrol D. gear shift E. carpets<n>Output: A. the oil<n><n>#Solution<n><n>Answer: Python for loop<n><n><n>```<n>if 0<=i<9<n>if  0<=j<9<n>counter+=1<n>if letter==i and the letter=letters, then f=3 if f<0 then f=-f<n>else f+=1<n>if counter==9<n><n>print ("fine= ",f," letters= ",the letter)<n>```<n><n>---<n><n>*

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:The museum made an odd choice for the koala display, they put the stuffed creature in what area where you'd usually find a panda? Choices:  A: jungle B: bamboo grove C: australian outback D: china E: child's book<n>Output:		C: australian out back<n>*/<n>#include<string><n>#include<iostream><n><n>using namespace std;<n><n>string getTheWord(int, string, string&);<n>string replaceStrings(string, string);<n>int countNumber(string, string);//helper method<n><n>int main()<n>{<n><n>    string word=[];<n><n>    string s1="box";//give input<n>    string s2="petrol"//give input<n><n>    cout<<s1<<" "<<s1.size()<<" "<<s2<<" "<<s3.size()<<endl; //initializing input<n><n>    cout << "Input: "<<s1<<"The machine was very intricate,"<<endl<<endl;<n><n><n><n>    //answer<n><n><n><n><n><n>    cout<<getTheWord(s1.size(),word,word)[0]<<endl;//first word[0] is the answer<n><n>}<n><n><n><n>string getTheWorld(int l1, string l2, string& w)<n>{<n>    w="";<n>    for (int i = 0; i < l1; i+=1)<n>    {<n>        if(isalpha(l2[i])) w="?";<n>        else w+=(l2[i]);<n>    }<n>    if(i==l1) w+="?";<n>    else w+=(l1-i);<n><n><n>}<n><n>string replaceStrings( string, string)//helper method<n>{<n>    string w="";<n>    int a = findString((string)+(string));<n><n>    for(int i = 0 ;i<a ;i++ ){<n><n>        if(toupper((string)[i])==(string)[a]) w+="x";<n>        else w+(string)[i];<n><n>    }<n><n><n>    return w;<n><n>}<n><n>int countNumber( string, string)    //helper method<n>{<n><n>    int z=0;<n>    for (int  i =0 ;i<(string).size() ;i++){<n>        if((string)[i]=='n') z++;<n><n><n>    }<n>    return z;<n>}<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:He finally found someone as ugly as him, knowing he wouldn't be the one sticking out was what? Choices:  A: gorgeous B: handsome C: pleasing D: glorious E: pretty beautiful<n>Output:		D: glorious<n><n><n>### Explanation:<n>In the first example, the correct response is 'apparatus' because the input and the output are identical, both the "what" and answer is the same ('apparatus'). In the next example, the correct response must be 'gas station' because although both part of speech are the same in output and input ('station'), the word'station' appears in the latter, which is the same word appearing in the input, and the response should instead correspond to the other of the two choices ('gas station'). In the last example, the correct response should be 'glorious' because once again, both the input and output are identical, but the word in question is a new word to both questions.<n>

Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:What is someone likely to feel after receiving a gift that is not common? Choices:  A: special B: personal C: offended D: unique E: rare<n>Output:		E: rare<n><n>Input: People tend to get along with those who are common to them? All sentences in the problem are correct, so your task is to find which of the non English sentences are correct and which are not.<n> <n>#### Examples:<n>```<n>The problem begins with "The first sentence is correct." The non English sentences are as follows.<n><n>The first is "The second sentence has three words in it."<n>The second is "This sentence is three words long."<n>The final sentence is "These are the last two sentences."<n><n>The answer is the following.<n>```<n><n>```<n>The first sentence is correct.<n>The second sentence has three wo<n>```<n>The solution is the following: The second sentence is not the example, but the second sentence, as well as the last two sentences are correct.<n><n>#### Difficulty: 1<n>#### Input: <n>This is a sample of the input you will receive from the program.<n>```<n>This is the first sentence.<n>The second sentence<n>This is a very short sentence<n>The next sentence is much like the last.<n>The next sentence, however, is much longer.<n>```<n>#### Output:<n>This is an example of the output you will see from the program. <n>```<n>The first is correct.<n>This is not a word.<n><n>These are the last three.<n>The problem ends: "The next sentence is much longer."<n>```<n><n>#### Problem: [problem03_sentences_from_the_textbook.txt and problem04_sentences_from.txt](./problems)<n>#### Solutions: [sol_problem02.txt](./solutions)<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:Too many people want exotic snakes.  The demand is driving what to carry them? Choices:  A: ditch B: shop C: north america D: pet shops E: outdoors<n>Output:		D: pet shops<n><n>Input:The man took a train, but then it was cancelled due to unexpected what? Choices: A: rain B: fog C: weather D: sunshine E: snow fall <n>Output: A: rain<n><n>Input:Do not try to use the car. The battery is dead. You'll simply have to use what? Choices:A: bus B: taxi cab C: a plane<n>D: a bicycle<n>E: train<n>Output: B: taxi cab<n><n>Input:He could not buy the camera. It was out of stock. His camera will never be at what? Choices: B: a store C: work E: his house D: any store<n>Output: B: a store<n><n>Input:The boss's daughter can hardly stand her fathers employees. She simply cannot stand them. Choices: A : bag B: bag measurements C: bags D E: bag sizes<n>Output: B: bag measurements<n><n>Input: What is wrong with your car? Choices: B : air pollution  C: carbon monoxide<n>D : fuel efficiency<n>Output: D: fuel efficiency  <n><n>### Instruction:This is a codegolf. The shorter your code, the better. You get one point for correctly answering. For a point, you must enter 1. For 2 get 2. For 3 get 3<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:He wanted a house that was gated off from other places, where should he start looking? Choices:  A: neighborhood B: subdivision C: city D: suburbs E: street<n>Output:		A: neighborhood<n><n>*Note:* Please try to do the exercise yourself before reading the correct answer.<n><n>### Solution<n><n>We will be using the `match` function which is defined as follows:<n><n>```python<n>def match(token, tokenList):<n>    """Return all the tokens from tokenList that are anagrams of token<n><n>    Args:<n>        tokenList (List[str]): List of tokens in lower case<n>        token (str): Token to find anagrams of<n>    """<n>    # tokenList = ['a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e']<n>    # token = 'b'<n><n>    if token not in tokenList:<n>        return []<n><n>    return sorted([x for x in tokenList if isAnagram(x, token)])<n>```<n><n>We could write the logic here: if no anagram of the input `token` is found in `tokenList`, it simply returns `[]`. Otherwise, we sort the `tokenList` in alphabetical order, and try to check if each `token` contained in `tokenList`, is anagram of the input token.<n><n>```python<n>match('A', letter)<n>// [ ['A'], ['AE'], ['EA'] ]<n><n>match('A', ['B', 'E'] + ['A'] + ['a'])<n>// ['A', 'AE', 'EA']<n><n>```
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:Mark's semen was very thick, but after his vasectomy it was also what? Choices:  A: blank B: sparse C: thin D: clear E: free flowing<n>Output:		C: thin<n><n>Input: The doctor wanted to put in the probe, but his hand was what? Choices: A: clear B: stiff C: weak D: tremble E: thick<n>Output: A: clear<n><n>Input: He had very few bones, in fact he was very what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: launch pad B: circus C: aircraft carrier D: large open area E: space station<n>Output:		D: large open area<n><n>Instruction:Use the python language.<n><n>### Expected output:<n><img src="./screens/ex1.png" alt="expected output" style="width: 90%" /><n><n>### Input: where do you get petrol<n>```python<n>import os<n>data = os.system('clear')<n>print('-'*5)<n>print('Welcome to the petrol guessing game!')<n>print('-')<n>print('-'-'---')<n>print('-------')<n>print('-': 500)<n>#guess the letter and write it on a space<n>for i in range(1,501):<n>    inp = input('Where do you guess it may be:'+str(i)+' ').strip()<n>    if(inp.strip() ==  inp.capitalize()):<n>        inp=inp.capitalize().upper()<n>        print('-')<n>        print('-'*2)<n>        print('-'.join(letters))<n>        print('-'-'---'.join(letters[0:3]))<n>        print('-------'.join(letters.lower().capitalize()))<n>        print('-'+inp+'-'*200)<n>        break<n>```<n><n>### Output:<n><img src = "./screens/ex2.png"  alt" " style=" width: 90%"  /><n><n>### Instruction:Answer the folowing question.<n><n>Input : Where do you get power? Choices:  C: sit down O: stand up P: walk around B: climbs up R: climbs down S: go for a walk  <n>Output: O: stand up<n><n>Output:<n><n>#!/bin/bash -l<n><n># The following script is a function for getting the grade from a test inputing the output as an answer.<n>my_grade () {<n># $1 should contain the grade<n>. /etc/machines/config.sh<n>	case "$*" in<n>		'A'|'A+'|'A-'|'A-+'|'A++'|'F'|'F+'|'F-'|'F-+'|'B'|'B+'|'B-'|'B-+'|'B++'|'C'|'C+'|'C-'|'C-+'|'C++'|'D'|'D+'|'D-'|'D-+'|'D++'|'D-4'|'L'|'Z'|'W'|'F'=A 'F+ 4/4 'F- 4/4 'E 4/4 'C+ 4/4 4/4 'B+ 4/4<n>		')'<n>		B'|'B--'|'B++|'B-4'|'B+++|'D++'<n>		'E-'|'E++|'F+ (or F+%) |'F++'|'F-'<n>		'F+ (or (F+) |'F++'<n>		;;<n>	esac<n>	echo -n '.'<n>}

Choices:  North America South America South Carolina<n> <n><n>### Instruction:Answer the questions below.<n><n>Write short essays and make sure to include some or the other example in your answer to get some points<n><n>Question: What does 'a big heart' mean to you? <n>                        Answer: When someone has a big heart, they have a good disposition. They are kind, selfless, and sympathetic to others. A person with a big heart truly cares about others and makes a conscious effort to help others when they are in need.<n>Question: When someone is kind to others, it is called what?. When you are kind, it means you are polite and considerate to others. Kindness refers to the qualities of being thoughtful or helpful.<n>Question: What does it mean 'to be a help' to somebody? To be a help is to assist somebody when they need you physically or emotionally. It means making a sincere effort to be of benefit and make someone else's life easier. Being helpful means being willing to lend a helping hand whenever you can.<n>Question: When you say something is 'exciting', you mean what? Exciting means you're happy and feeling positive about something that's coming up. When something is especially pleasant or interesting, you can call it exciting. It is exciting to know you're about to get good news or have fun, but it's also exciting to see a friend you haven't seen in a long time or to plan an adventure with them.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:The parents thought their children should learn teamwork, what were they signed up for? Choices:  A: throw things B: play sports C: play games D: play ball E: play chess<n>Output:		A: throw things<n><n><n>### Part A. <n>Given the following code:<n><n>```C#<n>using System;<n><n>class program1<n>{<n>    // 0. In your own hand write out the program flow using C# code.  <n>    // 1. In your own hand do the same using an algorithm flowchart.<n>  static void Main(string[] args)<n>  {<n>      Console.WriteLine("Enter a number between 4 and 10");<n>      int n=int.Parse(Console.ReadLine() );<n>      Console.WriteLine(n / 2 +n);<n>  }<n>}<n>```<n><n>Given the following algorithm: <n><n><n>### Your task is to add "using static void Main(string[])" and "using System" (with the C# code) to the existing code.<n>### Using System: It basically lets us use the functions available on the.Net framework. for example string.<n>### Instruction: Do not add the Main method, please just add the two lines I gave above. <n><n>When I get the next question I will ask you to do both.<n><n>### What is the difference between using System and using static void Main()?<n><n>System.Console is for outputting text from the computer. static is a word used to tell what is being used. void means the function doesn't return anything.<n><n><n>### How did you solve the task? <n><n><n>by adding the using static void Main() in the top and using System where it tells us we have access to the string functions.<n><n><n>

Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:How does a flea locomote? Choices:  A: attack B: suck blood C: stay D: lay eggs E: jump<n>Output:		E: jump<n><n>Input:How do most animals drink water? Choices:  Choices:  A bite B: attack C: jump D: lick E: run<n>Output: A: bite<n><n>```python<n># code starts here<n>import sys<n>sys.dont_write_bytecode = True<n><n>def main():<n>    answers = [<n>        # Qs<n>        ["box", "apparatus", "appliance", "implement", "instrument"],<n>        ["refinery", "gas station"],<n>        ["apartment", "bedroom"],<n>        [None, "locomote"],<n>        ["laboratory", "kitchen", "library"],<n>        ["bite", "attack", "jump", "lick", "suck"]<n>    ]<n><n>    def process_input(inputlines):<n>        processed = ""<n><n>        for i, line in enumerate(inputlines):<n>            # Get rid of lines which are only a space<n>            if line == " " and i == 0:<n>                pass<n>            else:<n>                processed += line + " "<n><n>        return processed.strip()<n><n>    for inputline in reader():<n>        print(process_input(inputline.split("\n")))<n><n>def reader():<n>    import sys<n>    rbuf = sys.stdin.buffer.chunks()[0]<n>    for line in rbuf.split("\n"):<n>        yield line<n><n>if __name__ == "__main__":<n>    main()<n>```<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:Where is a system of electronic devices likely to be used in school? Choices:  A: nature B: toilet C: computer science D: computer store E: human body<n>Output:		B: toilet<n><n>Input: What are a good source of energy used in an electric motor? Choices:  H: energy B: electrons C: electricity D: hydrogen E: gasoline<n>Output: B: electrons<n><n>Input: What did you feel after reading this poem? Choices: A: bored B: happy C: scared D: angry E: confused<n>Output: D: angry<n>  <n>Input: The best way to get to the market is to take a bus ______________? Choices: A: when B: whether C: if D: before E: because<n>Output: A: when<n>  <n>Input: Which are the best source of energy used in electric motor? Choices  : H: energy B: electron C: electric D: hydrogen E : gasoline<n>Output: A: energy<n>  <n>Input: Is the following sentence correct or incorrect? "I have seen this movie before." Choices : A: correct B: incorrect C: yes D: no E: both<n>Output: B: incorrect<n><n># import helper function for checking whether string contains the character 'a','e','i','o','u', 'A','E','I','O','U'.<n># use the function in the line below:<n>def my_helper(word):<n>    if word in ["aeiouAEIOU"]:<n>        return True<n>    else:<n>        return False<n><n># create the helper function to check whether the word ends with '-ing'.<n># call the function in the line bellow:<n>x = 'goed'<n>if my_helper(x):<n>   print("hello")<n>else:<n>   print("bye")<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? If the guess is acceptable, the type of word is printed and the program continues. Otherwise, the choice is incorrect and the program is repeated beginning with the next line of input.<n><n>For the purpose of demonstration, the acceptable category choice is 'animals' and the acceptable words are goat, dog, cat, horse, squirrel, snake, mouse, lion. <n><n>Input: The user guesses whether a type of word is acceptable.<n><n>Output: The word type to be guessed.<n><n>##### Exercises 8-10<n><n>Here is an example. The only words that begin with 'b' in the category are: boat, bear, bike. We get the category by typing 'cat' or 'food' or 'animal' and then the word to be guessed by typing 'bear' or 'boat' or 'bike' and

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:What do people who are speech therapists do? Choices:  A: make music B: believe in god C: give speeches D: complete sentences E: build houses<n>Output:		B: believe in god<n><n>Input: How do you think about a cow? Choices: 	A: milk B: eat C: kill D: raise E: bake<n>Output: E: bake<n><n>Input: What is it? Choices:  E: fruit B: an apple C: an orange D: a orange tree E: a snake<n>Output: E: a orange tree	<n><n>Input: How many times a day do you wash yourself? Choices:  B: once C: two times D: three times E: ten times<n>Output: C: two times<n><n>Input: The woman went to the theater.<n>Choices:  A: cinema B: cinema theater C: cine-mas D: theater cine-mas E: stage theatre<n>Output: C: cine-macs<n><n>### Explanation:<n>>How do you think about a computer? Choices:  C: Think about<n><n>### Partial Solution:<n>> <n>```javascript<n><n>function guess (str) {<n>  return str[0];<n>}<n><n><n>function chooseCandidate (pairs, ans ) {<n><n>    let randomNumber = Math.floor((Math.random()*pairs.length))<n>    <n>    let [answer,key,guess] = pairs[randomNumber]<n><n>    if (answer==guess){<n>    return key<n>    }<n>    else<n>    return 'wrong answer'<n><n>}<n><n><n>let pairs = [{<n>    answer:'cow',<n>    key:'k',     <n>    guess:'co'<n>},<n><n>{<n>    answer:'fire',<n>    // key:4,<n>    guess:'fi'<n>},<n><n>]<n><n>```<n><n>### 解释：<n>1. 每次试错时输出两字母的字符串，可以实现单字母输出<n><n>2. 遍历循环，每次输出一次一个字母，优化为只输出一次一行，就可以使循玩飘浮更多

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:What did the business require of everyone walking into their store? Choices:  A: wear shoes B: learn C: hope for peace D: have a great day. E: do well<n>Output:		B: learn<n><n>Input: What are you going to buy from the store? Choices: A: clothes B: dish C: gas D: car E: food<n>Output: A: clothes<n><n>#### Code Solution:<n>```python<n>def read():<n>    f = open('input.txt')<n>    s = f.read()<n>    f.close()<n><n>    return s<n><n>def get_ans(line):<n>    word_list = str().split(line)<n>    ans = ""<n>    for i in range(len(word_list)):<n>        if word_list[i] == "the" + "machine":<n>            ans = 'D'<n>        if word_get == "the" + word_list[i].lower():<n>            ans = 'B'<n>    if line == "the" + 'tv was':<n>        ans = 'E'<n>    if line in word_list!= "the" + 'TV' or "the" + "tv was":<n>        ans = 'C'<n>    if word_list[-1]:<n>        ans = 'A'<n>    return ans<n><n><n>s= read()<n>print (get_ans(s))<n>```<n>---<n>##### Reference: [Python solution](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/9102226/what-is-the-most-pythonic-way-to-split-at-specific-characters)<n><n><n>[Previoous Problem]<n>[Next Problem]<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  Choices: A: theatre B: library C: the book store D: travel agency E: shop<n>Output: B: library<n><n>Input:  If a sentence is not understood, we can say "What?" Choices:  A:"Are you all right?" B:"That is correct! C:"How did you know?" D:"That is not right!" E:"What?"<n>Output: E:"What?"<n><n>Input:  There is something wrong with the what? Choices: Choices: A: gas tank B: furnace C: drain D: engine E: stove<n>Output: C: Drain<n><n>Input:What do you do when you are on a crossroads? Choices: Choice: A: Turn around. B: Turn left. C: Turn right D: Turn up. E: Turn into.<n>Output: C: Turn right

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:The explorers found a central passage, much to their delight it led straight to the ancient buried what? Choices:  A: public building B: tomb C: arena D: large building E: treasure<n>Output:		B: tomb<n><n>#!/usr/bin/env python<n>import sys<n><n>def remove_whitespace(data):<n>	return " ".join(filter(lambda x: not x.isspace(), data.split()))<n><n>def check_answer(answers,correct):<n>	return any([(remove_whitespace(answer) == remove_whitespace (correct) for answer in answers)]) and (remove_whitespace (answer)!= remove_whitespace ("none of the above") for answer in answers)<n><n>def get_data():<n>	def make_answer_list(str) :<n>		line = int(str.split(' ')[1]).strip()<n>		answers = tuple([line for _ in range(line)])<n><n>		return answers<n><n>	correct = input('Enter the correct answer')<n>	try:<n>		data = [make_answer_list(i).split(' ')[1] for i in input('Answer')]<n>	except:<n>		data  = [make_answer(str, i).split(' ')[-1] for i in  input('Answer')] <n>	return data, [correct] <n><n>def main():<n>	try:<n><n>		if check_answer(data, correct):<n>			sys.exit(1)<n>		else :<n>			# print('wrong!')<n>	except:<n><n>		data = []<n>		correct = input('What is the correct answer? ')<n>		if check(data, correct): sys.exit(1) <n>		else:<n>			sys_out('wrong!') <n><n>#===================================================================<n>def check_and_outputs(data, ans_correct, out_file = None) : ## This function will only do the outputs<n>	try: out_file = open(out_file, 'w+', encoding = 'utf-8')<n>	except: ## If output file not exists and not the error with open <n>		out_file = open(str(os.getpid()) + '.txt', 'w+', encoding='utf-8')<n><n>	for i in ans_correct :<n>		out_data = out_file.write(i)<n><n>with open

Choices:  A: pet shops B: new mexico C: white house D: arctic E: garden of eden<n>Output:		C: white house<n><n>Input: When a snake prefers cold, snow capped mountains, where would it likely live? Choices: A: pet shops  B: new mexico  C: white house  D: arctic  E: garden of edenc Choices:  A B C D E<n>Output: E: garden of edon<n><n>##Instruction:<n><n>Given a string, print every distinct permutation of the given string<n><n>Input: Permutation of the string "abcd" Choices:  AB: CD: BC: AC D: AB: CD: BA: CB<n>Output: AB: CB<n>AB: CD: BA<n>BC: AC<n><n><n>In the problem there would be a string given. So that will be the first line of input. The first line of input should be only string. 1. The second line should contain all permutations of the given string.<n><n>```python<n>str = input()<n>print(str.permutations())<n>```<n><n>![image](../img/python/m02.jpg)<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:James was cooling off two quickly.  He would die if he didn't find some way to stop what? Choices:  A: loss of heat B: revenge C: expansion D: relaxation E: calm down<n>Output:		E: calm down<n><n><n>#### Solution<n><n>You may use the following method:<n><n>```java<n>public static boolean isMatch(String source, int num, String[] possibleAnswers) { // 이름과 검사 수 정확히 맞져야, 예외알고<n>    int i = 0, j = 0;<n>    String targetWord = possibleAnswers[num - 1];<n>    boolean result = true;<n><n>    if (targetWord.length() > source.length())<n>        result = false;<n>    while (j < targetWord.length() && result) {<n>        while (i < source.length() && (source.charAt(i)!= targetWord.charAt(j))) {<n>            if (j == targetWord.length())<n>                i++;<n>        }<n><n>        if (i == source.length()) {<n>            result = false;<n>        } else {<n>            i++;<n>        } // 한 위치만 너무 오르면 false로 전환, 동일 길이일 시 정렬 가능<n>    }<n>    return result;<n>}<n>```<n><n>```java<n>import java.io.*;<n>import java.util.*;<n>import java.lang.*;<n>import java.io.BufferedReader;<n>import java.io.* ;<n>import java.io<n><n>class Solution {<n><n>    public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException {<n>        try(BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(System.in))) {<n>            int temp;<n>            int ans = 0;<n>            String input = "";<n><n>            int i = 0;<n><n>            while((input = br.readLine())!= null) {<n>                String[] split = input.split("\\s+");<n>                if (i < split[0].length()) {<n>                    InputMchine(split, ans);<n>                } else if (i == split[0].length()){<n>                    break;<n>                }<n>            }<n>        }<n>    }<n><n>    public static boolean InputMchine(String[]

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: maine B: boston C: beach town D: coastal cities E: ocean<n>Output:		C: beach town<n>E.g. I asked, Where would you find an implement? Answer: A: the store? B: the car? C: The kitchen? D: The house? E: The woods?<n><n># -*- Mode:C; type:set -*-<n># -*- coding: utf-8 -*-<n>#<n># @File  : test.py<n># @Time   : Jan 20, 5:26:47 PM<n># @Author : zhengxionghu@foxmail.com<n><n>from data import Train_Data,Test_Data<n><n>def split_into_Train_and_Test(data,test_size=0.2):<n>    x = data['INSTRUCTION_TEXT']<n>    x=np.array(x)<n>    x=npzr.mean(x,1,keepdims=True)<n>    y= data['INSTRUCTED_ENTRY']<n>    y=np.array(y)<n>    y=npzr.max(y)<n><n>    indices = np.arange(len(x))<n>    np.random.shuffle(indices)<n>    <n>    np.random, np.random.seed(1)<n>    indices = npzr.random_integers(0,len(x)-1,size=test_size).tolist()<n><n>    # print indices<n>    TRAIN_set = data[data['INSTRUCTOR_TEXT']==x[indices]].reset_index(drop=True)<n>    TEST_set =data[data['INSTRUCION_TEXT']==x[:,np.random.choice(len(x)-1)]].reset_index(<n>        drop=True)<n><n>    #print('train_set ',TRAIN_set.head())<n>    return TRAIN_set,TEST_set<n><n><n>def pretrain_model(data):<n>    model = Sequential()<n>    model.add(TextCNN(data['INSTRUC_TEXT']))<n>    model.addModel(model.layers[-1] )<n>    model.compile(optimizer='adam',loss='binary_crossentropy',metrics=['accuracy'])<n>    return model  <n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? It has been a long day.')<n>sentence = c.sentence<n>w = (sentence.split())<n>print(w)<n>print(sentence.tokenize())<n>print(sentence)<n>print("****************")<n>sentence = ('The machine was very intricate.')<n>w = sentence.split()<n>#for sentence : sentence = "The machine was very intratec"<n>#for i,v in w: print(v,"i",i)<n>#print(w)<n>#for sentence in c.split(): print(sentence)<n>for sentence in c:<n>    sent_str = sentence<n>    sent_str2 = ''<n>    words_str =''<n>    w2 = sent_str.split()<n>    words_str += " ".join(w2)<n>    sent_str += words<n>    print(sent_str,'words_str',words_str)  # print out the words and the joined words<n>    for w1 in w2:  # print the word from the for loop<n>        for w2 in w2:<n>            sent_str2 += w1 +'' + w2 + '\n'  # join those words together in the second for loop<n><n>#for sentence in b.split(): print(word)<n><n>sent = input("Enter A sentence : ") # take sentence from the user<n><n>words = sent.split(' ') # split the sentence to array of word<n><n>for i in range(0,len(words)): #for each word in the sentence<n>    t=[]<n>    for a in words[i]:<n>        for b in words[i]:  # for each word in the word list which is same to the one in range function<n>            for c in b: #for each letter in the word in the range function<n>                for d in c:  #for each letter in each word<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:What's it called when you have seen something through an eyepiece? Choices:  A: sights B: optical illusion C: optical telescope D: light microscope E: binocular<n>Output:		A: sights<n><n>Input: The word couch in another language? Choices:  What:? A: what B: bouncy C: where D: sleeping E: couches<n>Output: A: what<n><n>##### [Solution]<n><n>### Exercise1:<n><n>This program is intended to provide simple menu based interface for user. It is expected that the user will enter commands to move cursor in the document. The program allows the user to perform three main operations, namely move upward by one line, move downward by one line and go to start or end (depending on the cursor position). The user has option to go back to start or continue from current cursor position.<n><n>The first part is a menu<n><n>You have successfully started a simple document viewer<n><n>[MENU]<n><n>  [1] Move upward by one line<n>  [2] Move downward by one line<n>[3] Go to start or end (based on cursor position)<n><n>[BACK] (Go back to last command selected)<n>1. 2. 3. 4. (Move forward to next command)<n><n>You have entered incorrect number of arguments. The arguments should be numbered within braces to allow to read the arguments from standard input. e.g. a[b,c,d] will print the argument values in that order.<n><n>Enter the command to be executed, or -1 to quit.<n><n>Move up by 1<n>Move down by 1<n>Go to start or end depending on the current cursor position<n><n>1<n>2<n>3<n>4<n><n>\$\end{code}<n><n>\section{Expected behavior}<n><n>In the program, a user has to enter choices from a menu. The main program is `if` statement to check whether any key is pressed or not. In this case, it must be recognized that while the user is typing the choice from the menu, the user will not press the enter key.<n><n>As a result, an `if` statement should be set up for the `getch()` function (for example) which means wait for a key press and then the corresponding choice will be set up.<n><n>\section{Source code}<n><n>The source code of the program is below.<n><n>\begin{code}<n>#include<stdio.h><n>#include<string.h

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:Traveling underwater has many dangers, such as low visibility causing what? Choices:  A: disorientation B: due to C: meeting new people D: getting somewhere E: relocation<n>Output:		D: getting somewhere<n><n><n>#Author: Vishalkur<n>#Author E-mail id: vishalk212@gmail.com<n><n>"""<n>    This is a function to solve the logic based problem.<n>    """<n>def solve():<n>	n=int(input("Enter the number of choice you want to guess: ")) #gives the option to enter the choice of option wanted in guessing.<n><n>	while(n>0): #loop while 0. <n>		x="a"<n>		for i in range(n):<n>			choice=input("Enter your guess: ")<n>			if(choice in x):<n>				break<n>			elif choice.capitalize() in x:<n>				print("Your guess has the same character. Please enter the right one " )<n>			else:<n>			#break<n>				choice=choice.capitalize()<n>#Input: The machine was quite an what?<n>		while(len(x)<n):<n>		<n>				x+=x+" "<n>		print("You are right! :) Your  \tAnswer :  "+str(choice).lstrip().upper())<n>		<n>	n-=1<n>	<n>solve()<n>

Choices:  b: in hardware and furniture stores c: in markets, grocers, and hardware stores d: in stores that sell appliances e: in the furniture department<n>Output: D: in stores that sell<n>appliances<n>### Instruction: Answer the following MCQ<n><n>**Input** :What does a telephone do?<n><n>**Output** :<n><n>**Input**: How are telephones used in business?<n><n>**Output:**<n><n>**Input:** Where should you go to buy a car?<n><n>**Output :**<n><n>```python<n>if machine_wash_dish=='A':<n>    print("A")<n>elif machine_wash_list=='B':<n>    print("B")<n>elif machine_wear_apparel=='C':<n>    print("C")<n>elif machine_clean_stove=='D':<n>    print("D")<n>else:<n>    print('Wrong answer')<n>```<n><n>```python<n>machine1 = input("Input your own machine1 answer:")<n>if machine1=="burn":<n>machine2="hot"<n>elif machine1=="cool":<n>machine2="fuel"<n>else:<n>machine2="tank"<n>print(machine2)<n>```<n><n>``` python<n>print (answer)<n>```<n><n>### Instructions: Please write a Python 2 program that will determine whether the input represents either a single appliance OR a combination of appliances that could exist. The appliances included in a single unit MUST be a telephone, and a washing machine AND a dryer (for laundromats), AND a stove AND microwave (for the stove and microwave combination). After the input is given, your code should first print the appliance, then state whether or not the appliance appears in the combination (which could be done by another print).<n>##### Input: Which appliance is this? Choices:  P: telephone  S: stove  B: microwave  O: stove and

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:The master control for the Tardis is where in the main room? Choices:  A: nuclear power plant B: center C: basement D: main office E: bowel of the ship<n>Output:		D: bowel of the shi<n><n>Input: Do you like watching black and white television programing? Choices:  B and W programing A: color television programming C: blue ray B: black and white television program E: green screen<n>Output: D: black and white television programming<n><n>Input : What is the most advanced method of driving? Choices:  Electric car A: bicycle C: fuel tank B: gasoline powered electric car E: diesel D: fuel cell<n>Output: C: fuel tank<n><n>```python<n>class solution(object):<n>    def num_of_instruction_for_a_complicated_machine_input(self, instruction, input):<n>        """<n>        :type instruction: str<n>        :type input: str<n>        :rtype: int<n>        """<n>        answer = [[0 for x in range(4)] for y in range(4)]<n><n>        if instruction == 'what' :<n>            if input.upper() == 'WHAT' :  <n>                return 1<n>            if input.lstrip()!= input.lstrip():<n>                return 2<n>            if input.lower() in ['what', 'what does this mean', 'what does this say', 'what does this read', 'what would that say', 'what would this mean', 'what is it', 'what does this state']:<n>                return 3<n>            else :<n>                return 16<n><n>        if instruction[0] == 'where' :<n>            if [input[x]] == [x+1] : return 1<n>            else : return 17<n><n>        if instruction.lower() == 'where does the water go to' :<n>            answer[2][1] = 1<n><n>        return max(answer[i][i+1] for i in range(2))<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? [what?]<n><n>```python<n>from fm import utils<n><n><n>def task1(sentence=None):<n>    if sentence is None: return ""<n><n>    # We use a for loop because we are going to iterate through a list of words.<n>    # As a result, we are iterating through the text a character at a time. You may<n>    # find it helpful using a while loop instead. (see next exercise)<n>    # This variable should contain all of the words in the sentence to be queried.<n>    # If the program is executed as is, without inputting a different sentence, the<n>    # words will be taken from the input sentence.<n>    # You can also pass different sentences to different exercises, which is good<n>    # for testing them. <n>    words = sentence.split()<n><n>    # this variable will contain the current word in the iterated sentences.<n>    # As you iterate through the sentence, you'll pass the index of the iterated<n>    # words to this variable like this:<n>    # for index, word in enumerate(sentence, start=1): # here we're going to start our iterating after the <n>    #'sentence' and pass the index to 'word'<n><n>    word = words[index]<n>    # This variable will become the index of the sentence.<n>    index = words.index(word) # 'words.index(word' just indexes the text with the passed word.<n>    return "" if index < 0 else None<n><n>if __name__ == "__main__":<n>    # The rest of the exercises are part of a single task<n>    output = utils.task1(input_text=input(130), debug_output=True, output_type="code")<n>    print(output)<n>```<n><n>## Exercise 1:<n><n>### Instruction:What does the phrase **a lover likely to do with their partner** mean?<n><n>### Task:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>The machine was very intricate. What would you call a computer or laptop if there is none around?<n><n>Computer is the electronic device with internal components to store data as well as to process it. It can also communicate with other devices electronically. Whereas a machine is a device that does not possess any electronic circuitry, it just does one or single task and does not have any circuitry  or logic board to handle information and communication.<n>If we do not have one around to use we can type on a keyboard and store data using an external storage device like pen drive or hard disk<n><n>### What would you call a smartphone if there is no internet?<n><n>A smartphone is an electronic communication device with internal circuitry to process information as well as store it. Without internet it will be an ordinary phone.<n><n>### Why is the internet important?<n><n>Internet is the most important and the fastest way to communicate, information is sent very fast. Internet is a huge network of computers that are connected. <n><n>### Are smartphones dangerous?<n><n>Smartphones are dangerous as children can spend their time online more and less communicating with the outer world as it helps them develop into something in future. Internet can also be a very dangerous place as there is a lot of cyberbullying and hacking in which privacy is lost and very difficult to regain it.<n><n>### How do you control your internet usage?<n><n>You can limit yourself to social media. And watch cartoons or movies with your parents.<n><n>### Do smartphones affect a person's life?<n><n>Yes it does have a very big impact on a person's life.<n><n>### Can you find food, jobs, or homes using the internet?<n><n>Internet has helped reduce so many things and it is possible to find jobs, houses and food online.<n><n>### What are some advantages of technology in your life?<n><n>It has made our lives

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:What's the nickname of the monster the beauty loved? Choices:  A: beast B: ugly C: ugliness D: satellite E: top of mountain<n>Output:		D: ugliness<n><n>Input: You can get rid of your old television with the waste recycler. Choices:  A B: C D E:<n>Output: E:<n><n>Input: What are you going to do today? Choices A: B: C: D: E. F. G.H.I<n>Output: H: Hi<n><n><n>### Explanations:<n><n>### Question 1<n>This question is to see if you know how to use the parser to check spelling in a token. The program that checks spelling in tokens is the spelling checker. It goes through and finds every token and then checks to see if there are any errors. It returns an error when it finds an error. The answer is a spellcheck parser.<n><n>### Question2<n>We first look at looking for the correct pronoun. The question wants us to look for the right pronoun according to the the word. We use the lookAt function to first find if there is a pronoun that matches and if it exists. If there is not, we need to look at the following words until we find something that matches. If there is not a word that matches or we do not get a match, then a match is not found. The program checks for a match at the third token which is what I put in for the input. If there is a word that matches the machine, then the answer is yes. If there is no word that matches the machine then the answer is no.<n><n>###Question3<n>We want to check to see if there is an abbreviation, so we look for (A, B, C etc) that matches between the second and the third tokens. Our lookAt function checks for the letter and its index value at the same time. If the letter is not in the index, then we assume that there is no abbreviation at the time being. Abbreviations use lowercase letters. Our answer is if there is an (abbreviation), then its is yes. Otherwise, we answer no to the question.<n><n>###Example4<n>The parser searches for the words I put in for the question, the second and third tokens. Because two words are found, and the token after are found to be correct, the answer is yes.<n><n>###Explanation5<n>When we were talking about pronouns, I said that if we do not find a pronoun that matches

Choices: 	A:  box B:  car C:  bag D:  bagel E:  backpack<n>Output: D:  bagel<n><n><n>Instruction: Use a regular expression and write a shell script to solve all the problems<n><n>Regression:				<n><n>```<n>[[email protected]~/Desktop]$ cat -n REGEXP.sh<n>1<n>#!/bin/bash<n><n>case ${1} in<n><n>  "a"|"A") ;;<n>  "B"|"B") ;;<n>  "C"|"C") ;;<n>  "D"|"D") ;;<n>  "E"|"E") ;;<n>  *) echo 'Not match!'<n>   ;;<n><n>esac<n><n>```<n><n>Then the script is simply to generate each line in the file, print out the 1st and 3rd characters in each line(which are case insensitive, so we always work with lowercase characters here),  then use  case command to make the script compatible with different cases.<n><n>For each line, we can test the input string with a regex match or with the following code:<n><n>```<n>[[105|192|200|208|221|225|229|240|241|252|262|263|267|270|282|306|332|363|367|373|382|388|390|424|656|902|923|939|944|992|993]]|(9|13|16|17|18|22|23|27|34|67|73|86|97|180|193|204|207|388|430|572|673|676|677|992|192|193|196|216|219|86|90|121

If the user was to enter a choice which is not in the expected range, the game will respond accordingly.<n><n>The third question is also a what? question. This time, the user must answer the correct choice and not the most common one.<n><n>The forth question requires the user which of those was more than 7 days. The user must choose between four options, which all have a different number of days. If the choice is not an answer which is out of order then the game will end.<n><n>If the user were to choose Tuesday instead of Thursday, the game will end. Similarly, if the user chooses more that 8 days, the game will end by displaying the answer.<n><n>### Implementation:<n><n>```java<n>import java.util.Scanner;<n><n>public class quiz6376565 {<n>    public static void main(String[] args) {<n>        Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in);<n>        String first = "+58";<n>        String third = "Father";<n>        String fourth = "Basketball";<n><n>        int mt = Integer.parseInt(second.split("/")[0]);<n>        int days = Integer.parseInt(first.split("/")[1]);<n>        int result = Integer.parseInt(third.split("/")[2].concat("-"));<n>        int count = 0;<n>        int sum = 0;<n><n>        System.out.println("Quiz is Over");<n>        count = days;<n><n>        while(count - 1 > mt) {<n>            System.out.println(first + "/" + second + "/" + third);<n>            System.out.println("What can you get for " + days + " days?");<n>            System.out<n>           .print("(Please enter correct answer)A: " + first + "\t");       B: " + second + "\t");   C: " + third + " \t");<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:Eating breakfast with a large family leads to a pile of what in the sink? Choices:  A: fullness B: underwear C: bad breath D: better day E: dirty dishes<n>Output:		C: bad breath<n><n>### Solution(s)<n>```py<n>class Solution:<n>    def wordBreak(self, s: str, words: List[str]) -> List[bool]:<n>        # s, words = words, s <n>        letters = s <n>        answer = []<n>        letters = [i for i in letters if i not in [' ', '+']]<n>        if letters == []:<n>            return [False] <n>        for word in words:<n>            tmp = word<n>            indexs = [i for i, x in enumerate(words) if x == tmp]<n>            answer.append([False] * len(indexs))<n>            letters = [j for i, j in enumerate(letters) if i not in indexs]<n>        if letters!= []:<n>            return answer<n>        for i in range(len(letters)):<n>            answer[i][0] = True<n>        ans=[True]*(len(letters)+1)<n>        answer, ans = word_breaker(s, letters, 0, ans)<n>        ans = [True]*(len(answer)+1)<n>        ans = word_break_ans_2(ans)<n>        ans, ans1 = word_break_answer(ans, answer, [])<n>        for answer in answer:<n>            if answer == False:<n>                ans = [False] + ans<n>                ans = filter(lambda i: i == True, ans)<n>                ans = list(filter(lambda i: i[0]==True, ans))<n>                ans = [a == i for i, a in enumerate(ans) if i < len(ans)]<n>                ans = [True]*len(ans)<n>                ans = filter([lambda e: e == True], ans)<n>                ans.extend([True]  * (len(ans) * 2 - len(ans1)))<n>                ans.extend(list(repeat(False, len(ans) - len(ans1))))<n>                ans<n>        ans = list(filter([lambda i: i == False], ans))<n>        ans.append(True)<n>        ans<n>```<n>### Notes:<n>A. To solve this problem I used the following methods:<n><n>1. Divide it into two sections of `wordBreak` and `wordBreakAnsew

Choices:  It is not in what:  A: path we have lost our way B: a way C: where we were walking D: way we were going E: way we were coming<n>Output: E: way we were going<n><n>Input: The children liked their new schools. Choices:  to drive A: I can B: I do C: I want not D: I like not E: I must not<n>Output: B: I can<n><n>input: The box is how much to the box? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  a: car b: truck c: ship d: bus e: helicopter f: submarine<n>output: a:car<n><n>```<n>import java.util.*;<n>public class English<n>{<n>  public static void main(String[] args)<n>  {<n>    Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);<n>    String choice;<n>    while(true)<n>    {<n>      System.out.println("This is a program with English instruction. You will see questions every few steps.");<n>      boolean start = false;<n>      do{<n>        System.out.print("\nWhat is your what? " +choice);<n>        choice = scanner.next();<n>        if(choice == "A"){<n>          System.out.println("\nApparatus: The tool you use to make something. Like a carpenter tool or an engineer would use a machine.");<n>        } else if (choice == "B"){<n>            System.out.println('\nBox: The container for something. Like a box of nails.');<n>        } else if(choice == "C"){<n>               System.out.println ("\nAppliance: The tool you use if it does not need to be used. Like a TV or a radio to listen to. ");<n>          } else if (choice== "D"){<n>                System.out.println('"Implement: The tool you would use at the right time. Like using a hammer or shovel on concrete. It might hit the floor.');<n>            } else if (choice=="E"){<n>              System.out.println ('Gas station: A place where you get gasoline or petrol.');<n>             } else{<n>               start = true;<n>             }<n>        }<n>    if(start == false){<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  C: an instrument B: a yard D: meter E: appurtenance A: distance<n>Output: B: a yard<n>- I chose the wrong answers of the two questions in the second part, because <n>there was no need to read the whole sentence in order to understand the correct <n>answers, I only needed to read the first one to complete the questions. Hope this <n>helps<n>- The reason I answered the question to the first one the way I did was because the <n>question says where the machine could be used, and to me the word for that is <n>'apparent'<n>- The word instrument in the second exercise means a musical instrument, because <n>the question is looking for a word that is specific for this definition that the <n>speaker is actually using when he meant to use the word'measuring device' that <n>would have been used if the question was "Where can you get a musical instrument?"<n>- I didn't give a wrong answer for the rest of the questions, except for the last <n>one because I did not know exactly what the word 'appurtenance' meant, so I <n>guessed that is was a tool that helps you measure distance in some way, but even <n>though the correct answer was 'a measure of distance' I still believed that a <n>measure of distance can also be the distance from one thing to another one<n>---<n><n><n>### Instruction:Answer the questions below.<n>Exercise 1:<n>In the past people had to carry buckets of water to work. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:What does playing soccer for a long time lead to? Choices:  A: excitement B: fatigue C: anger D: hurting E: getting tired<n>Output:		D: hurting<n><n>Input: What is the opposite of "fast"? Choices:  A:"slow's" B:"slow,s" C:"fast" D:"slow" E:"slow,d"<n>Output: B:"slow"<n><n>Input: What can you put in "hot"? Choices:  Choices:  A:'hot' B:'hot,d' C:'hot' D:'hot,s' E:'hot'<n>Output: A:'hot'<n>#### Solution:<n><n>```python<n>def solve(m, n):<n>    #Write your code in Python.<n><n>    m = ["a", "b", "c", "d", "e"];<n>    n = int(input())<n><n>    for a in range(n):<n>       s, t = input().split(" ", 1)<n>       if(s == "What is the opposite of " + t):<n>          ans = "D"<n>       else:<n>          ans = "A"<n>       if(s.split(",")!= t.split(",")):<n>          ans = "C"<n>       print(ans)<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:Joe suffered many consequences from stabbing a stranger to death.   Among them, the family of the victim did something to him. What was that? Choices:  A: knife wounds B: buy a gun C: bleeding D: jail time E: law suit<n>Output:		E: law suit<n><n>Input:Why does it take so long to get a visa in some of the countries? Choices: 	A: They are just too large B: The air traffic is bad C: It’s because they are rich D: The visa processing costs too much E: There are too many people applying for visas<n>Output: C: It’s beacause they are rich<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>Input: <n>![](http://d.ai2.acm.org/papers/d14-0209/0414/0533/d14-f0414-05331.png?width=800)<n><n>Answer:<n>![](http://i.imgur.com/XzGmdSq.png)<n><n>Explanation:<n>1) Box<n>2) Apparatus<n>3) There is a house, hence the TV is in the bedroom.<n>4) The consequences include getting arrested, so the family sues Joe. <n>5) All of the options listed could cause a delay, but that last line indicates there are too many visas being asked for to process.
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:Where in Southern Europe would you find many canals? Choices:  A: michigan B: new york C: amsterdam D: venice E: bridge<n>Output:		E: bridge<n><n>---<n>#### **Solution**:<n>---<n>```python<n>>>> <n>    def get_input(string_input):<n>      global _ans<n>      if string_input.find("?")!= -1:<n>        string_input = string_input.split("?")[1]<n>      elif string_input.isdecimal():<n>        string_input=string_input.digits()<n>        string_input='.'+string_input<n>      return string_input.strip(),_ans<n><n>    def main():<n>      string_input = input("What is the input: ")<n>      answer,_ans = get_input(string_)<n>      print answer,_ans<n>    main()<n><n>Output: What is the input: The machine was very complex, it was a what?<n>   A: box<n>   B: Apparatus<n>   C: appliance<n>   D: wash dish<n>   E: implement <n>A: box<n><n>Output: What do you get petrol from?<n>   A: burn hot<n>   B: fuel tank<n>   C: burn hot<n>   D: car<n>   E: gas station<n>E: gas station<n><n>      _<n>    __     .<n>    __  ____ ___<n>  ' /.      \:<n>  : / /  '<n>  (::' \::\""\"\\<n>(::' \::\""\<n>  (::' :: \"\\<n>   E:\`\"        \  "\"<n>               "     "<n><n>  Output: What type of animal would you see in the woods?<n>   A: cabinet<n>   B: house<n>   C: apartment<n>   D: bedroom<n>   E: woods<n>E: woods<n><n>... <n>```<n><n>---<n>### **Revision** <n>---<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:What is a person chatting with friends likely hoping to accomplish? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: increased energy B: healthier C: loose skin D: beauty E: death<n>Output:		A: increased energy<n><n>Input:What were you trying to put something on? Choices:  X: shelves Y: cupboard Z: cabin Y: refrigerator<n>Output: Y: cabinet<n><n>#####################################################################<n>Instruction:Answer the following three open question.<n><n>Input1: Are there any differences in the use of "a what" and "the what"?<n>Output1: There are many differences in the use of “a what”. The what is used for indefinite singular nouns, such as books, animals, places, and things. It is also used for indefinite names of organizations, teams and companies. The what is also used for some uncountable nouns, such a glass of water and some tea. It is also used to refer to things in an unclear place, this may describe the state of something, such as a broken machine. An indefinite word is a word that is not stated and may have more than one meaning. While the indefinite pronoun what is used in a sentence, it is the most common pronoun (word to refer a person, place or thing). The what refers to something or someone unknown, unspecified or indefinite. For example: What a lovely tree! It is amazing How can anyone be so ignorant? I think there's a what there, don't you? It is the way the What has been used in this example that has confused you, you can say that there could have been a cat in that tree, or an unknown person/thing. You can only use the indefinite pronounce what to refer to things in general, not to refer to an unknown or indefinite subject. The what is used to ask questions, such as: What shall we do now? What's this? The what is also one of the shortest words in the English alphabet – it has just one letters! It is sometimes used without any preposition before it, for example: “It is just a what but it is so cute!".<n><n>Input2:Can nouns function as an Adjective, Noun, Verb and Pronoun? How do you make nouns function like an Adjective, Nou, Verb and Pronou?<n>Output2:  The nouns in English grammar are classified as either common or proper. Common nouns refer to people, places,

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  A: burn hot B: fuel tank C: burn hot D: car E: gas station<n>Output: E: gas station<n><n>Input: Where might a television used at night be? Choices:  A: cabinet B: house C: apartment D: bedroom E: woods<n>Output: D: bedroom<n><n>Input:If you're speaking to a lawyer about getting a divorce, what relationship status are you trying to end? Choices:  A: being married B: sisters C: marriage D: two people E: lawyer<n>Output:		D: two people<n><n>Input: Which word are you using to describe how you feel when you have a cold? Choices:  word A: bored word B: hungry word C: sick word D: tired word E: no word<n>Output: D: tired word<n><n>Input: How much more do you need to save to finish the game? Choices: A: 82 percent more B: 4 percent more C: 49 percent more D: a lot more E: I have been saving, I am finished<n>\end{code}<n><n>\strong{Solution:}<n><n>\begin{code}<n>import sys<n>import StringIO<n>import pandas as pd<n><n>def is_list(iterable):<n>    return isinstance(iterable, (list, tuple))<n><n>def parse_quotes(text):<n>    lines = text.splitlines()<n>    # 10% of the lines of the text are dummy<n>    dummy_count = 10<n>    quotation_count, dummy_count = 0, 0<n>    for num in range(dummy_count):<n>        quotation_number = 0<n>        count_of_last_line = 0<n>        for line in lines:<n>            if line.strip() in ["#", "\t", "\n"]:<n>                quotation_number += 1<n>            else:<n>                # if not the last line, count the number of quotation marks<n>                count_of_last = line.count("'")<n>                # if the last line, count all quotation marks of it<n>                if count_of_lastline <= 1:<n>                    count_of_last += 1<n>                count_of = count_of_last + count_of_last - count_of_last<n>                # increase count_of_last by one after the number of the last line in a paragraph when there's a quotation mark<n>                if count_the_last_number > 5:<n>                    break<n>            quotation_number += count_of<n>            quotation_count += count_of_last if count_of_the_last < 0 else count_of_last else 0<n>            count_of_last -= 1<n>            if line == '\n':<n>                count_of += count<n>                dummy_count +=
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: The machine was very intricate, it was quite an what? Choices:  A: box B: apparatus C: appliance D: wash dishes E: implement<n>Output: B: apparatus<n><n>Input: Where do you get petrol? Choices:  E; 0 Amps A: Amp B: Ohms C: Watts D: Volt<n>Output: D: Volt<n><n>B: What is the largest part of a TV?<n><n>Input: The screen is the biggest in a TV, and it is made up of multiple smaller pieces of glass.<n><n>To get a good picture, the TV screen needs bright lights and sharp pictures, so the TV uses light bulbs. Choices:  a: in cabin b: trunk c: in apartment d: in hotel e: in woods<n>Output: c: in apartment<n><n>***<n><n>	Instruction: Read the following question carefully and use complete sentences to answer the question.<n>	<n>	What do all of the following have in common: a washing machine, the TV, the attache case, the  office suitcase, and the gas station?<n><n>	A. It is more common to carry them with us.<n><n>	B. It must be connected to a power supply to be used.<n><n>	C. Sometimes they contain hot water.<n><n>	D. People can sleep in them.<n>
